intro: Hesperhodos minutifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hesperhodos minutifolia is often found in open habitats such as plains, grasslands, and disturbed areas.
